headline: Homemade Blueberry Pie
description: Blueberry pie with a gorgeous lattice top is hard to beat! This easy recipe is ideal with fresh berries but mighty fine with frozen ones too.

video.description: Make a delicious fresh blueberry pie, complete with lattice crust.
video.name: Blueberry Pie

name: Homemade Blueberry Pie
recipeIngredient: 1 (14.1 ounce) package double-crust pie pastry, thawed

recipeInstructions.text: Set an oven rack to the lowest position and preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Mix sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon, and salt together in a bowl; sprinkle over blueberries.

Line a pie dish with one pie crust. Pour berry mixture into the crust and dot with butter. Cut remaining pastry into 1/2- to 3/4-inch-wide strips. Use the strips to weave a lattice top. Crimp and flute the edges.
Bake pie on the lowest oven rack until filling is bubbling and crust is golden brown, about 50 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Very easy recipe and very good! Made it last night and there's only I slice left! First time making a blueberry pie!
I have made this pie several times, always comes out amazing!

I loved the pie it was delicious. I followed the recipe except I didn’t bother with the lattice top. I also heated the blueberry mixture just enough to thaw my freshly frozen blueberries as this was a spur of the moment decision.

Just made this for Christmas Eve, and it was a hit with everyone! I followed this recipe down to a tee, but one change that I made that I absolutely recommend is adding lemon juice. It does a phenomenal job of bringing out the flavor of the blueberries, and the pie has a nice tangy and tart taste as a result. I squeezed the juice of at least one lemon and strained the juice with a sieve. After the dry ingredients are mixed in with the blueberries, I poured in two tablespoons of the lemon juice into the mixture and folded it all in with a rubber spatula. Then I left it to set for at least an hour (the longer the better) before baking as directed to have the blueberries absorb all of the flavors. I hope this helps!

This came out perfect. I preheated my oven with a drip pan, and reduced to 375 as soon as I put the pie in, thinking that would brown the bottom better, and it did. I used just over 4 TB corn starch. I substitute sugar with erythritol, 1 to 1 , and it tastes very natural and not too sweet. It set beautifully and sliced well. Will definitely keep this recipe .

Made this for the 1st time and it was a hit. But definitely tweaked it based other reviewers' suggestions. Used 5 cups of fresh blueberries instead of 4 cups Used 6 tablespoons of cornstarch instead of only 3 tbsps Used 1/2 cup of sugar instead of 3/4 cup. Was right mix of tart and sweetness (not too sweet) Cooked at 400 for 45 minutes. Edges did turn brown. Think next time, I'll try @ 375 degrees for 50 minutes I let it cool for several hours.

I like how easy this was, although I wish it mentioned somewhere to let the finished pie sit for a few (3 or 4) hours to let it congeal fully. I’m new to fruit pies/thickeners and didn’t know this: I got frustrated with the initial “runny”ness of it. I then read other blueberry pie recipes and learned such. PATIENCE with letting it cool/congeal. And I would use less sugar. A personal preference.
Loved it
This is by far the best recipe for blueberry pie that I’ve made.

I’ve used this recipe for years, simple and everyone loves it! I use 4 generous tbsp of cornstarch (5 if using frozen blueberries) and a small squeeze of lemon. I omit the cinnamon now which really lets the berries shine ;) Love the lattice crust but will sometimes do a full top and carve out “thank you” or someone’s name to ensure no one else touches their pie lol

I made this pie ,but I added an extra cup of blueberries because I used a deep dish pie plate. I also added 4Tbsps of cornstarch ,but I had to bake it about 20 minutes longer before it started to boil and set. I still love this recipe though.
Added 1\4 tsp nutmeg and 1 tsp vanilla. Smells amazing!
I was pretty disappointed since it was so runny. I added extra cornstarch as per others suggestions but it still wasn’t enough. The taste wasn’t so bad but I wont be using this recipe again.
I added 4 tbs of cornstarch instead of 3, but it was still very runny. Tasted amazing, however! And the texture was better after reheating leftovers from the fridge the next day.
Best blueberry pie I’ve ever eaten ! Easy directions . My family and I Loved it !!! Plan to make it all blueberry season .
Perfect texture and taste!

Decent recipe. Definitely needs more cornstarch as others noted. So 4 tablespoons works. I’d also add a little lemon juice to brighten it up a bit. Lastly at least another half cup of fresh berries. It basically works but needs the tweaks.

This pie is very easy and quick to make! I had made this last berry season and used the mini pans. A quick trip to the grocery and didn't locate those so I used the 8" pie. I like crust, so therefore I will look more throughly next time. I will also cut the cinnamon to 1/4 not 1/3.
Very yummie
A bit too sweet for my taste and it was runny! I should have used another tablespoon or two of cornstarch.
This is a very good pie thanks for whoever came up with it.
Because it's ok other than I think u guys are right and should adjust temperature in video and recipe thanks for recipe

It was delicious, my husband said it was the best blueberry pie he ever had. I modified to 4T of cornstarch. Covered with aluminum foil on the edges for 15 minutes to prevent burning. I also added a little lemon to the blueberries and put sugar on top of the crust before baking!
Made a pretty good cobbler but I was trying to make pie. I think double the starch might be sufficient.
Just remember to mix all of your dry ingredients before you put the blueberries in. Cut the top crust with a pizza wheel. Super yummy! 😋
Taste was ok. But was to soupy. Never firmed up. Oh well, always other recipes to try.
Love this pie and so many others do too!! I just have to stop burning my crust
I’ve made this 3 times now but this time I used 6 Tbsp of corn starch and it wasn’t runny as in the past. Very good.

I made this for my room mates birthday. I used exactly the ingredients specified and inside was liquid and never set. Sadly I ended up having to tip a lot of it out when I cut the pie. After 40 mins of baking, I covered it with foil and continued baking (60 min total) but it didn’t have enough starch to set it at all. i’m kind of sad i didn’t heed the warnings in the comments. DEFINITELY put 5Tbs of corn starch. Tasted really good though and paired well with my home made french vanilla ice cream.
My first blueberry pie and it was amazing.
Beautiful flavour??TYVM??
used big blueberries from Sams club.. need to use 7-8 TBLS cornstarch. The smaller the berries the less cornstarch needed. up the sugar to 1 cup.
I made this pie to take to the Blue Hill Fair in ME this weekend. I am entering it into the Wild Blueberry Pie Contest! Woo hoo!

Delicious! I upped the sugar to 1 cuo, added a little more blueberries (fresh) since I was using a store-bought deep dish pie crust, 5 T cornstarch and 2 T bottled lemon juice, baked on a cookie sheet for 1 hour at 375° quick bake setting, turning the pie a few times for even browning. I would do everything exactly the same next time except I would not increase the amount of the blueberries since this one oozed blueberries all over the place and there were still tons inside. Be sure to use a cookie sheet! I also made blueberry frozen yogurt while I was at it and that also came out fantastic! Thank you! I will definitely be saving this recipe.
Followed the recipe exact. Delicious! My husband loved it. Will make again. Just the right amount of sweetness. I used fresh berries.

Very yummy and easy. I keep the cornstarch as is, but for all fruit pies I add 1-2 Tbsp of minute tapioca. Glass pie plate on a cookie sheet that you heat up in the pre-heat process. Helps avoid soggy bottom, as does starting at 425 for 15 then lowering to 350/375.

I followed the tips from Juniper's rating and topping suggestion. That crumb topping is excellent. It took a bit long for mine to cook as I used frozen berries. 4.5 berries and 4T cornstarch. Otherwise I followed the recipe. I somehow lost the bottom to a tart pan, so now I use the side of it around over the top of pies to prevent the crust from browning too quickly.

Great base recipe. I made a few tweaks: -Used 4 scant cups (so more like 3 1/3) of fresh blueberries and dropped the sugar to 1/2 cup. I heeded the advice of others to increase the cornstarch to 4 tbsp. I also added 1/4 tsp of coriander power in lieu of the cinnamon I then added 1/2 of a lemon and all of the zest. I think next time I’d macerate the fruit in the sugar for an hours and then add the rest. After dotting with butter, I baked at 425 for about 1 hour and then dropped the temp to 375 for 15 more minutes. Fruit had nicely set and wasn’t dry either.
I made this recipe exactly as it calls for and all that it needs is eating it fresh!! Good recipe

Normally I use Minit Tapioca to thicken fruit pies if needed but didn’t have any so followed the advice of others and used 5 tbsp of cornstarch. Fail! I could taste the cornstarch after baking for an hour. Very disappointing. Won’t make this again.
Wonderful! I added 2T lemon juice and some lemon zest.

I altered the recipe slightly as other people had suggested. I did 5 Tbsp of cornstarch, 1 Tbsp of lemon juice and added 1/2 top of vanilla extract along with the other ingredients. I also buttered the pie tin to prevent the crust from sticking. I baked at 375 on the center rack for 50 minutes in my conventional oven, allowed it to cool and it set beautifully even at room temperature. If you have a convection oven (where the air/heat is circulating in the oven reduce the temperature to 350 and the cook time will change). Lastly, I egg washed the top crust to give it that nice shine. Happy baking.
I did not think it was thick enough. It was good, but I do not care for it to run while I am trying to eat it. I may use more cornstarch next time

This is a delicious pie especially warmed slightly with vanilla ice cream . I cut the sugar to a half cup and used 4Tbsp as suggested by some of the reviews. I cut up and froze half the pie to keep from eating it all in two days.

This pie was yummy !!!!
Only thing I changed was 5tablespoon of cornstarch & 2 tablespoon of lemon as the lady before me had done 
Everyone loved it 
It was perfect

Tastes great! However, I used 5 tablespoons of cornstarch and it didn’t set until it was cooled. My mom used to “precook” the blueberries and mixture on the stove before pouring it into the crust. Bake time would only be until the crust is the color you want. Maybe that’d do the trick. It was still extremely yummy!

I’ve made this pie twice- Super yummy!! 
I always precook the bottom crust in my pies before I add the filling. Made the lattice crust and sprinkled the top with sugar. Baked for about 30 min. Fresh berries pop in your mouth. One of the best pies!!

So good and always a hit - I've made this with both fresh and frozen and not noticed a difference so now I always use frozen (2 12oz bags) and add 5T cornstarch with minimal leaking (I think 6 T would be too much). Note that this is for a deep pie dish, a standard dish will need about 1/2c less berries. I also add 1T lemon juice and zest of 1/2 a lemon to brighten.
I have made this recipe multiple times. I find it easy peasy and delicious every time.
Perfect... will make again.
Just what I needed a quick easy recipe!!

Best pie ever! We had freshly picked blueberries and made pie crust from scratch. We used the advice from other reviewers and increased cornstarch to 5 TB and added freshly squeezed lemon juice. Unbelievably good!
Easy and delicious. Served with some fresh whipped cream and was a huge hit. Forgot to take a pic when out of overnight but it went fast
Delicious! My husband loves this pie.
easy to make and loved by the entire family
Very good! Use lemon juice to taste, make sure to use less if your blueberries are on the tarter side. Add a tablespoon or two more cornstarch, and it'll be a hit!
OMG it's so good.

Never made blueberry pie before and it turned out great. I had 5 cups blueberries so I adjusted a few things. I ended up using 5 cups berries, 5 Tbsp corn starch and 1 cup of sugar. I also added 1 tsp of lemon juice. Kept the salt and cinnamon the same. I baked at 375 for about 55 minutes.
Turned out great!
Perfect. I substituted flour for cornstarch as I live in Germany and have not been able to find it here. Otherwise, made as indicated and loved it! Will make again.

Absolutely delicious! Easy to make. The lemon adds such a flavor punch. The crust is flaky and buttery. We did follow the suggestions for more cornstarch and lemon, which in our opinion made all the difference! My husband made it for Christmas and I asked when he would make it again!!!
Fantastic pie! We add the zest and juice of one lime to the filling. It’s my family’s favorite.
It was delicious!
I had to lower the temp but other than that it was good

Tried submitting a photo but the mb is to large. This was our first ever blue berry pie. First time I ever made a pie, and it was absolutely amazing. My family asked for one every day for 5 days in a row. We did homemade crust and it was just 100 percent amazing. Thank you for sharing your recipe with us!

Followed the recipe exactly. I used pre-made pie crust bought from the store. 

I coated the blueberries in the sugar mixture by carefully folding them together to get a better coating and spread of sugar. After adding the blueberries to the crust, any remaining sugar mixture that didn’t stick I poured over top. 

Created a lattice and had extra dough so I added the bow. 

My husband and I both loved it.

Personally, you might have been too quick to change the temperature of the oven. In my past experience, I've always baked my fruit pies by starting out with a preheated oven at 425° for 15 minutes, then I turn the heat down to 375° or so for the remaining cooking time. Just my opinion but I have found that using this method has always resulted in a beautiful, brown, and flaky crust
375 was too cool to get the crust to brown. My crust recipe called for 450. I raised the temp up to 425 for the last 15 or so because the crust wasn't browning.

Amazing! My first pie to ever make and I am pleasantly pleased! I read the reviews and did do a few tweaks. I added 5 TBS of cornstarch and 2 TBS of lemon juice and that's it! The pie was not overly sweet and you could taste the freshness of the blueberries! I will make this again and save to my recipe book for the holidays!

So I went with some of the suggestions, 1 cup sugar and 5 tablespoons of cornstarch. Also added 2 tablespoons of lemon juice. Seemed like all the sugar was on bottom and was way to sweet . (Could feel the sugar.) And even with the extra starch, it was still soupy. So not sure what went wrong........on the upside it was pretty!!!
YUMM!!!
good one!
Yummy

This pie recipe is amazing! Quick to make and so delicious. I took the advice of others and used A splash of lemon juice and doubled the corn starch. In the first one I used the cinnamon, but in the second cut that in half and it was perfect!

I loved it! I typically buy a frozen pie, but it's out of season and hard to find. I read several of the reviews and took suggestions. I'm staying in my guest house while the other house is built and I'm short on counter space. I bought Walmart's Great Value frozen blueberries, frozen deep-dish pie shell, and refrigerated ready to bake pie crust for the top. I let the crusts get to room temp. I used 5 cups of frozen blueberries (not thawed) and 5 TB cornstarch. I added an extra tsp. cinnamon, 1/2 tsp of nutmeg, and 2 TBs of lemon juice. I baked it on a cookie sheet on the lower shelf for 15 minutes at 400 degrees and the lowered it to 375 for another 45 minutes. I let it set 2 1/2 hours and it was perfect. No runny mess! The crust was flaky and crisp on the bottom. It was delicious!! I will make this again for sure! Very easy!!!

Loved it, I used around 1/3rd of a teaspoon of cinnamon instead of 1/2. I also used a little more salt recommended because I feel like it brings out the flavor of the blueberries more. Finally, brushing the top crust with egg yolk and then sprinkling cinnamon sugar over it really gave the crust a delicious flavor and a nice gradient of texture.
Turned out great! I made it spooky though!

I made this pie for company and I’m completely disappointed with the results!! The picture speaks for itself! The recipe calls for 3 tbsp corn starch but before making this pie I looked at the comments, people said 4 tbsp of cornstarch and others said 5; I decided on 4.5 tbsp. Ingredients aren’t free, please update this with appropriate measurements so people aren’t wasting their time and money!

I made this twice, once as directed, once with double the corn starch per the comments. I even let it cool an hour before cutting into it. Still a watery mess. I'm moving on, this recipe isn't doing it for me. Not again...
Made it sugar free Great recipe. I used 5 Tbsp of corn starch and substituted Erythritol for sugar and it was perfect! Excellent!
Used 4.5 tbsp cornstarch and 2 tbsp lemon juice And bit extra cinnamon
This was delicious and is now my go to recipe for blueberry pie. I did use 4 tbsp of cornstarch and it was perfect after cooling for two hours.
Have made this recipe multiple times!

delicious, if a bit on the sweet side for me. realized halfway through that i didn't have cornstarch, so i used double that amount in flour and it seemed to work out fine. also accidentally used only 3 cups of blueberries, but it seemed like a fine amount so maybe my pan is small?
Delicious recipe especially for farm fresh blueberries.
I definitely will make it again but with a little less cinnamon!
I made it to recipe except didn't want a lattice top and it never set even adding 10mins to recipe. Still like soup! So disappointed, I just picked my berries too.

This pie was simple and delicious, easy, quick to pull together. I used 5 cups blueberries and 1 additional tablespoon of cornstarch, per the reviews. I let it sit before cutting - at least 6 hours, and I refrigerated it for some of that time. I think that helped it hold together (as so many here complained that it was too runny). Family LOVED it. I do recommend putting a baking sheet under the pie; my crust didn't seem to be browning very fast so I removed the sheet - the juices promptly heated to bubbling and spilled all over my oven (my own fault, obviously - just a warning!).
Perfect blueberry pie
This was the funniest pie I’ve ever made.
This recipe was perfect and the pie was gone on a hour ! I put a dollop of cool whip on each slice. So delicious !

This was the first blueberry pie I have ever made. One thing I learned is that I should put the lattice strips closer together so I’ll have more crust on top and so it’ll keep most of the goodness inside. I put a little extra blueberries in mine and had a bit of a mess drip over into my oven. Next time I might not lattice the top to keep all the blueberries inside. It was still delicious! Everyone had 2 slices lol

Delicious recipe!! After reading other reviews I increased the cornstarch to five Tablespoons and lowered the temp to 375°. 
Going forward I will increase the sugar from 3/4 cup to at least 1 cup
This is the best recipe I have ever made. I probably added more blueberries but yours probably doesn’t leak on your oven while cooking. Lol
Edit to my last review - I used 2 TBSP (not 2 tsp) lemon juice and let the pie cool for at least 1 hour before cutting and filling was perfect (not runny at all).

Delicious! This is my second time making this recipe. 

Make sure you watch the pie cooking time, 375 for 50 minutes, it was almost over done so I will start at 45 minutes next time and keep checking.

Delicious! This is my second time making this recipe. 

Make sure you watch the pie cooking time, 375 for 50 minutes, it was almost over done so I will start at 45 minutes next time and keep checking.

Made it as written !! Found it very easy and satisfying. I used a counter top convection oven. This is my second pie with this recipe, the first also came out good. I but I used the super-convection and the crust browned fast, didn't burn!! The second time I used the no-convection selection.

Very tasty! I did add zest from half a lemon. I do think I need to add more cornstarch- it was just a little runny for my liking. But other than that - it must have been good, my mom actually licked her plate clean!!
